- If the rule is "conjunctive", the machine only turns on when all of the blickets are placed on top of it.
- You should always consider first the hypothesis that all the blickets have to be on the machine for it to turn on (i.e. "conjunctive" rule). You should consider this both when taking actions to uncover which objects are blickets, and when asked about it.
